Option 1: The vehicle on your right side
Option 2: The vehicle on your left side
Option 3: Both of you have the right of way

Question: You should always drive at a speed which will allow you to:
Option 1: Stop within 60 meters (200 feet)
Option 2: Stop within 90 meters (300 feet)

Question: If you want to pass a motorcycle, you should:
Option 1: Turn on your high beam lights, as the driver on the motorcycle has small mirrors
Option 2: Flash your high beam lights to get the driver's attention
Option 3: Treat the motorcycle as any other vehicle and pass it normally
Option 4: Use half of the lane to pass the motorcycle

Question: When should you yield to the right of way ?
Option 1: At an intersection without signs or lights, yield to the first vehicle or if both vehicles stop at the same time, yield to the vehicle approaching from the right
Option 2: When entering the road from a private road or driveway, yield to the pedestrians and traffic on the road
Option 3: At a pedestrian crossings and school crossings with crossing guards.

Question: Most automobile skids are the result of:
Option 1: Driving too fast
Option 2: Hard breaking on the road

Question: Which of the following is incorrect?
Option 1: When 6 demerit points have been accumulated, a letter will be sent to you advising you to improve your driving skills
Option 2: When 9 demerit points have been accumulated, you may be called in for an interview and a driver re-examination
Option 3: When 15 demerit points have been accumulated, your licence will be suspended for 30 days
Option 4: When 15 demerit points have been accumulated, you will lose your licence for up to 2 years

Question: What must you do when switching lanes in traffic?
Option 1: Signal correctly and check your mirrors before switching lanes
Option 2: Check your blind spots before switching lanes
Option 3: Turn off your signal after switching lanes

Question: Which of the following hand-and-arm signals is correct for slowing or stopping?
Option 1: Arm out and up
Option 2: Arm straight out the window

Question: When another vehicle wants to overtake and pass your vehicle, you must:
Option 1: Reduce your speed to keep the vehicle behind you
Option 2: Accelerate to keep the traffic flowing
Option 3: Move to the right and allow the vehicle to pass
Option 4: Move to the left to prevent  the vehicle from passing

Question: What is the best way to stop quickly on a wet or icy road?
Option 1: Take your foot off the gas pedal and focus on your steering as your car slows down
Option 2: Pump the brake until you come to a stop
Option 3: Step on the brakes as you normally would
Option 4: Fully step on the brakes to prevent skidding

Question: When driving in heavy fog,you should use:
Option 1: High beam head lights to increase your range of vision
Option 2: Low beam headlights to increase your nearby vision
Option 4: Parking lights and high beam headlights

Question: When parking downhill on the road curb, you must:
Option 1: Use your parking breaks to prevent the car from rolling down the hill
Option 2: Turn your front wheels to the left and set your parking brake
Option 3: Turn your front wheels to the right and set your parking brake

Question: If you are driving on a road and suddenly your right tire goes off the road, what is the safest way to get back on the road?
Option 1: Apply the gas pedal and steer hard to the left
Option 2: Apply the brakes and steer hard to the left
Option 3: Take your foot off the gas pedal, and steer left when vehicle has slowed down
Option 4: Apply the brakes and steer hard to the right

Question: When is a u-turn prohibited?
Option 1: When there's a "No U-Turn Sign"
Option 2: On a railroad crossing or within 30 m (100 ft.) of a railroad crossing
Option 3: On a hill where the driver's view is less than 150 m (500 ft.) in both directions

Question: When entering a freeway you should signal,then:
Option 1: Stop on acceleration lane,wait for an opening,then enter the freeway rapidly
Option 2: Drive slowly and be prepared to stop for freeway traffic
Option 3: Slow down,enter the freeway at a sharp angle
Option 4: Accelerate quickly to freeway speed and merge with freeway traffic

Question: A broken center line on a roadway means you may:
Option 1: Never pass
Option 2: Pass at any time
Option 3: Pass if the way is clear

Question: When you are driving along the road, you should:
Option 1: Always keep to the middle lane
Option 2: Always keep to the right

Question: If you are planning to making a U-Turn, what is the first thing you should check before making a U-Turn?
Option 1: The amount of space needed for a U-Turn
Option 2: The pedestrians

Question: If you are driving and suddenly one of your tires blows out, you should:
Option 1: Concentrate on steering wheel
Option 2: Take your foot off the gas pedal to reduce the vehicle speed
Option 3: Try and bring the vehicle to a stop off the road
